page.title: 13RAILWAYS AND CANALS
page.content: {Railways.}There are 2 railway lines that run through our area.As one from Rugby it splits into a single track line to Northampton; joining up again south of Northampton with the main Rugby/London line.They both have automatic signalling and are diesel/ electrically operated. There are 3 tunnels to travel through - the longest being about 1 and a quarter miles.Fine castleated tunnel shafts can be seen on the surface. George Louis Stevenson stayed in Kilsby during the construction of Kilsby Tunnel. The{Oxford Union Canal}goes through a tunnel 1465 yds long. As you enter the tunnel the tow path is on the left. There are 3 bridges over the canal, one is a road bridge and two are farm bridges.The canal is popular for fishing and holidays in narrow boats.
